node.text:
Have you explored DYNAMIC EQ yet?⁣
⁣
This feature can be incredibly useful in certain situations, especially on really dynamic material like vocals. ⁣
⁣
Let us know if you have any great uses for dynamic EQ!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This might be a bit controversial, but is BALANCE as an artist overrated?⁣
⁣
We’re not saying you should ignore your mental health, and never rest. Rest is important. But in order to really reach your goals, you do have to make some sacrifices!⁣
⁣
What do you think??⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣
⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This topic is BIG… and it’s a question we see all the time…⁣
⁣
How do you FIND YOUR SOUND?⁣
⁣
It all comes down to making more music! And over time, your sound will naturally emerge!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This one goes in the Reverb Tip “HALL OF FAME”
⁣
⁣⁣
Watch the video to fully see how to go about “syncing” your pre-delay to the BPM of your track! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Pre-delay is the amount of time it takes until the initial onset of reverb.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
What do we use it for?⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Mainly to create separation between our original sound, and the reverb itself. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
If that reverb begins immediately, it can wash away some of the punch/transients/clarity of our sound. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Because pre-delay introduces a timing difference, it can quickly muddy things up if it’s not rhythmically delaying with the rest of your mix. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
It can create an odd hiccup where things sound out of time. Similar to when you first begin DJ’ing and can’t beat match 😭⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Some reverbs have this “tempo sync” feature already built in. Theres also a formula to do this “delay calculator” trick. Honestly, it’s much quicker to just bookmark this page!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Type your BPM, and try out different values. See which seems to “gel” the reverb to your mix best!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Works great on vocals, leads, drums, and more. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Did you learn something new today? Comment and let us know! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣

VOLUME!⁣

node.text:
We see a lot of questions about managers. When do you need one? Should you try to find one now?⁣
⁣
A lot of producers think a manager is going to help make them successful. But remember, the only person that can make you successful is YOU 💪⁣
⁣

node.text:
😭 If you use samples, you might want to make sure this is turned OFF! ⁣
⁣
⁣
After doing 1-on-1s with hundreds of students, I’ve learned that this setting in Ableton is a REAL problem! ⁣
⁣
⁣
Many are unaware this “auto-fade” setting is even on!! 😕⁣
⁣
⁣
The issue is when you drop a sample in (that’s already perfectly cut), it creates a fade at the beginning and end of that sound. ⁣
⁣
⁣
This affects the attack on kick drums, snares, hats, claps, and ANYTHING that is transient.⁣
⁣
⁣
You lose all of that important punch! Listen to the difference in the example.⁣
⁣
⁣
Fades are important for when we’re cutting / editing audio. But for those who aren’t recording, and instead do a lot of drag and drop samples...TURN IT OFF!! ⁣
⁣
⁣
It’s much easier to add a fade when you need one vs having to undo it on every single sound. ⁣
⁣
⁣
🤓 Follow @cosmicacademy 🤓⁣
⁣
⁣

node.text:
🏆 A VERY important step when working with vocals!
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Vocal Comping is an art, and skill, that can take your productions to the next level. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

If you've ever recorded vocals before, you know you never get it "right" on the first, or only one, take. Vocal comping is when you choose the best words, or phrases, from each of your takes...to combine and create the "ultimate" take.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Some DAWs have comping features built-in (protools, logic, etc) that make the process fast and easy.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Even if your DAW doesn't have such luxuries, it's easy to set up. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Drag in all your vocal takes and align them on separate tracks, one on top of another. Go through each take and choose the best word, words, or full phrases from each takes and copy them (in same timing and order) onto an empty channel below which will act as your *Final Comp*.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
This process is MUCH easier if you take notes during the actual recording process. For example you might love the way a certain phrase was sung in "Take 3" during recording...write it down. These notes come in handy when you have to go through all your takes again. This process can be tedious, but it helps a ton in your final vocal stem you will begin to tune and process.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Hope this helps ❤️⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
@cosmicacademy⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
⭐ Which are yours?⁣ ⁣⁣⭐ Here are our FAVORITE EQ plugins for VOCALS!
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
When mixing, the vocal deserves your tender love and care. You need to treat it right!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
That's why we came up with this list of our favorite EQ's to use during vocal processing.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Analog EQ emulations are always a nice choice here because they provide an extra bit of harmonic color / saturation / "warmth" that digital EQ's won't.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
This doesn't mean you should throw your Pro-Q3 or stock EQ away...as you can see we still have it listed here! They are still great for precision cuts / cleanup.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Wondering where you can find some these plugin emulations? Many companies make them, but here are a few that have the EQ's listed:⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣
Waves (Pultec, 1073)⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Plugin Alliance Bundle (Maag, 1073)⁣⁣⁣
⁣
UAD (Maag, Pultec, 1073, Trident)⁣⁣⁣
⁣
Arturia (1073, Trident)⁣⁣⁣
⁣
Softube (Trident)⁣⁣⁣
⁣
T-Racks (Pultec, 1073)⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
❤️ Compression can be hard to understand...hope this helps!!
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
**This one is worth SAVING** ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️THRESHOLD - a level that is set (measured in dB), which will tell the compressor to turn on when the signal exceeds it...and turn off when the signal drops back below it.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️RATIO - how much the signal exceeding the threshold will be compressed. The amount of gain reduction that takes place in compression is primarily an interaction between threshold and ratio. Higher ratio's will cause more reduction at the set signal level and threshold. Lower ratios cause less gain reduction for that same signal level and threshold.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️ATTACK - the amount of time it takes the signal to become fully compressed, after exceeding the threshold. This is not a "delay" before compression starts working. The signal lowers immediately once it crosses the threshold. The attack just determines how long it takes to reduce the level. That slope of lowering the signal can either happen very fast, or a bit slower.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️RELEASE - the time it takes to go from compressed signal, back to the original uncompressed state. This begins once the amplitude of your signal has dropped back below the threshold.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
🎛️MAKEUP GAIN - your overall level will be quieter after compression...as evident by the "gain reduction" meter. The goal of compression is not to LOWER, or even raise, the volume...if thats what you wanted to do, you can just move the fader. Compression deals with shaping the dynamics of a sound. If your sound is quieter after compression, add some makeup gain so its back to the level it started at. Now any change you hear in the sound is a result of COMPRESSION and not your level just being different! ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

⁣

node.text:
🧐What is OTT actually doing?!
⁣
⁣
The famous OTT compressor (which you can DL for free on the Xfer site, Ableton has one too) is a form of Over The Top compression. ⁣
⁣
⁣
This is because it gives you the ability to combine downward and upward compression at the same time! ⁣
⁣
⁣
DOWNWARD COMPRESSION reduces the loud sounds over a certain threshold.⁣
⁣
⁣
UPWARD COMPRESSION increases the loudness of sounds below the threshold, while leaving the sounds above it unaffected.⁣
⁣
⁣
When you combine both, you get this dramatic compression sound on your signal!⁣
⁣
⁣
Any time the signal in L, M, or H band exceeds, it lowers it.  Anytime the signal then drops back below the threshold you've set, it raises it!⁣
⁣
⁣
You can also pick and choose to just use one, or the other, if you'd like as well.⁣
⁣
⁣
You can use the knobs for Upwards & Downwards to have more or less of each.  You can also "command" or "control" click in the multiband sections themselves to bypass Upwards or Downwards in just one specific band! ⁣
⁣
⁣
We're always stressing the importance of understanding your tools, so you can then use them any ways you deem necessary.⁣
⁣
⁣
Small examples like this, will add up in the long run and allow you to get the sound you're looking for (creative and mixdown).⁣
⁣
⁣
Hope this helps!⁣
⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣
⁣

node.text:
🏆These analog emulations come STOCK with Logic!
⁣
⁣⁣
I'm sure you've had sleepless nights wondering this... 😜 but we're here to help.⁣⁣
⁣
⁣⁣
The stock compressor in Logic Pro X is AWESOME! It consists of 7 compressors, in 1!⁣⁣
⁣
⁣⁣
6 of those 7 are modeled after actual hardware compressors. No need to look any further for analog emulations...they provide them for you! And for STOCK plugins...these sound REALLY nice! ⁣⁣ Swipe through both pages to see them all.
⁣
⁣⁣
Logic Pro X also has a stock VINTAGE EQ collection, which is modeled after 3 analog EQ's but we can save that for another day!⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣⁣
If you found this useful, smash the LIKE and be sure to follow:⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉@cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This might be a bit controversial, but is BALANCE as an artist overrated?⁣
⁣
We’re not saying you should ignore your mental health, and never rest. Rest is important. But in order to really reach your goals, you do have to make some sacrifices!⁣
⁣
What do you think??⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣
